avdta.sav.dispatch

Class Dispatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.sav.dispatch.Dispatch
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultDispatch

    public abstract class Dispatch
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines methods called by SAVSimulator and SAVOrigin to dispatch taxis. Subclasses defining dispatch behavior should override these methods. The following behaviors are undefined: taxi route choice, matching travelers to taxis However, travelers will exit a taxi that arrives at their destination. This class does not have to include that. After arriving at a centroid, a taxi's path will be null. Assigning a valid path to a taxi at an origin will cause the taxi to try to depart. (If travelers entered the taxi, the taxi must first wait for Taxi.DELAY_ENTER.) SAVOrigin contains a set of unassigned taxis. See SAVOrigin.addFreeTaxi(avdta.sav.Taxi) and SAVOrigin.removeFreeTaxi(avdta.sav.Taxi) to make use of this feature. The dispatch should update these sets, if they are to be used. When a taxi arrives taxiArrived(avdta.sav.Taxi, avdta.sav.SAVOrigin) it should be added to the appropriate free list, if it is not immediately assigned to another trip. When a taxi departs, it should be removed from the appropriate free list. SAVOrigin also contains a list of enroute taxis. Whenever a taxi changes paths, it will update the lists of enroute taxis via SAVOrigin.addEnrouteTaxi(avdta.sav.Taxi) and SAVOrigin.removeEnrouteTaxi(avdta.sav.Taxi). These methods also update traveler estimated departure times, based on a first-come-first-served assumption.

        public SAVSimulator getSimulator()

        Returns:
        the simulator in use

      • taxiArrived

        public abstract void taxiArrived(Taxi taxi,
                                 SAVOrigin node)
        This method is called by SAVOrigin when a taxi arrives at an SAVOrigin. (Taxis arriving at SAVDestinations may dwell there for some time before moving to the SAVOrigin. Note that the taxi may have passengers currently in it, but all passengers destined for the linked SAVDest have already exited.
        Parameters:
        taxi - the taxi that arrived
        node - the SAVOrigin the taxi arrived at

      • newTimestep

        public abstract void newTimestep()
        This method is called by SAVSimulator every time step.

      • newTraveler

        public abstract void newTraveler(Traveler person)
        This method is called by SAVOrigin when a traveler departs and requests a taxi.
        Parameters:
        person - the departing traveler

      • initialize

        public void initialize(SAVProject project,
                       SAVSimulator simulator)
        This method is called by SAVSimulator after data has been read. It should be used to initialize any instance variables that are dependent on the project or network. Subclasses should call initialize(avdta.project.SAVProject, avdta.sav.SAVSimulator).
        Parameters:
        project - the project
        simulator - the simulator

      • reset

        public void reset()
        This method is called by SAVSimulator to restart the simulation. It should return the dispatch to the appropriate state for the start of simulation. Subclasses should call reset().

      • travelerDeparted

        public abstract void travelerDeparted(Taxi taxi,
                                      Traveler person)
        This is called when a traveler departs an origin.
        Parameters:
        taxi - the taxi the traveler departed on
        person - the departing traveler

      • getPath

        public Path getPath(SAVOrigin o,
                    SAVDest d)
        Returns the stored path associated with the origin and destination. Paths are updated every Simulator.ast_duration.
        Parameters:
        o - the origin
        d - the destination
        Returns:
        the stored path

      • setPath

        public void setPath(SAVOrigin o,
                    SAVDest d,
                    Path p)
        Updates the stored path associated with the origin and destination. Note that paths are updated every Simulator.ast_duration.
        Parameters:
        o - the origin
        d - the destination
        p - the new path
